## Advance Procurement Notice
### Construction of Next Generation Fighting Vehicle Facility, Petawawa, ON

#### Background and Purpose

The Government of Canada, through Defence Construction Canada - Ontario Region, is issuing an Advance Procurement Notice (APN) for the construction of a new facility to provide storage and light maintenance capability for a fleet of next-generation fighting vehicles. This APN is not a bid solicitation, but rather an opportunity for contractors to begin the sponsorship request process for obtaining the necessary security clearance(s) required for the contract.

#### Project Description and Estimated Value

The project involves the development and construction of a new facility, estimated to be approximately 2,700 m2 in size, to be located within a developed compound at Garrison Petawawa. The overall design and construction value of this project is estimated at $16,000,000.

#### Security Clearance Requirements

To be eligible for contract award, a contractor must hold a valid and active Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET granted by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Contractors who do not currently hold this clearance may begin the sponsorship request process through Defence Construction Canada's (DCC) Industrial Security Program (ISP).

#### Sponsorship Request Process

To initiate the sponsorship request process, contractors should submit an application via DCC's website at https://www.cdc-dcc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements. Contractors are required to provide their contract number C001776 and the level of clearance requested. DCC will review the application and communicate directly with the contractor to complete the sponsorship request package.

#### Additional Information

*   The procurement model for this contract is Modified Design Build.
*   The procurement process is expected to begin in Spring 2023, contingent upon contract approval by the Department of National Defence.
*   The tender documents and bidding information are available at http://www.merx.com.
*   Fees may apply; see https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information.

#### Contact Information

For questions related to this APN, please contact:

*   Jason Myers, Team Leader, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada, (613) 401-5522, Jason.Myers@dcc-cdc.gc.ca.

This Advance Procurement Notice is subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the attached Notice.  Bidders are encouraged to review the Notice carefully before proceeding.
